The proposed contract will have irrevocable clause(s) for a one-year period (2023-2024) with possibilities for extensions up to three more additional years.
full_summary:
# **Plumbing Services Tender Announcement**

## **Notice of Proposed Procurement (NPP)**

Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada's Brandon Research and Development Centre invites bidders to submit proposals for plumbing services on an "as and when requested" basis. The successful contractor will be required to provide services for a period of one year, with an option to extend for up to three additional one-year periods.

**Security Requirements**

To ensure access to sensitive work sites, contractors/personnel requiring access must hold a valid RELIABILITY STATUS, granted or approved by Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada.

**Services Required**

The services required include:

* Plumbing maintenance and repair
* Site visits to identify and address issues as needed

**Technical Requirements**

Proposals will be evaluated based on the entire requirement of the bid solicitation, including technical and financial evaluation criteria. Mandatory technical evaluation criteria include:

* Compliance with all relevant laws and regulations
* Demonstration of relevant experience and qualifications
* Provision of a comprehensive proposal that meets all requirements

**Duration**

The contract period will be for one year, with an option to extend for up to three additional one-year periods. The anticipated start date is October 1, 2023.

**Submit Proposal**

Bidders are required to submit their proposals in two official languages: English and French. The deadline for submission is July 25, 2023, at 3:00 PM CDT (local Brandon time). Late submissions will not be accepted.

For more information and to view the bid solicitation documents, please visit: <https://canadabuys.canada.ca>

**Important Contact Information**

- Contracting Officer: Desta Kissack, Senior Contracting Officer, Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada, Western Service Centre, 4-303 Main Street, Winnipeg, MB R3C 3G7, Phone: (204) 583-8127, Email: desta.kissack@agr.gc.ca

AAFC has adopted the Integrity Regime administered by Public Services and Procurement Canada. As a result, the integrity provisions are being applied in AAFC procurement activities as outlined in this solicitation.

The federal Indigenous Business Directory (IBD) is an online resource for Indigenous businesses to identify capacity and compete for federal government contracts set-aside for Indigenous businesses. For more information, please visit: <www.canada.ca/indigenousbusinessdirectory>.
A profile in the IBD can increase your company's visibility and provide additional business opportunities.СРТ
